intro: Potentilla wiemmanniana, commonly known as the Alpine cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are compound, consisting of five oval-shaped leaflets, and are covered in a fine layer of downy hairs. Potentilla wiemmanniana thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and dry grasslands.
